content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good problem! I like when a piece of paper is useful

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is a good problem!
Seems like your code is not accepting long integers. So that the Large Value Test outputs the wrong answer. Maybe change the constraint to A ≤ 2^15 and  0 ≤ B ≤ 2^15 ?

Test case 7 seems to be broken - I get an output of 4294967293.
Remove the test cases involving negative values of A, or change the constraints appropriately - you cannot state that 1 ≤ A ≤ 2^31 and then provide a value of -50. Constraints must be accurate across all cases.
Besides that, it is a fairly nice problem. If you fix those two issues, then you should be good to go.

Validators should be very similar to the test they are paired with, so that they test the same aspect of the problem. For example, you should have a test and validator pair which both have B>A.

I would let A be 0, but it shouldn't be valid for the tile size to be 0 or negative.

I like the CoC once I figured out what you were trying to say. but I guess you're not fluent in English since your profile states that you are based in France, so here's a translation for your CoC:

Statement
A square of side length [[A]] is tiled by whole squares of side length [[B]]. Output the remaining area of the first square that is not covered by the tiled squares.

If the second square is larger than the first square, output {{ERROR}}.

Input
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[A]] for representing the side length of the first square
<<Line 2:>> An integer [[B]] for representing the side length of the second square

Output
A single integer representing the remaining area of the first square not covered, or {{ERROR}}

Constraints
1 ≤ [[A]] ≤ 2^31
0 ≤ [[B]] ≤ 2^31



----------
It is not standard to include constraint-checking in a puzzle on Codingame, so I (1) explicitly stated what happens when B > A, (2) removed negative side lengths (it doesn't make sense unless you rephrase the prompt as a programming a calculator), and (3) restricted A to positive values.

Also, you should move this submission to WIP status, because there are a lot of things that need changing.

Indeed, I do not speak fluently, I still make some mistakes thank you for correcting me :)

I rephrase the end of the prompt a bit to make sense with the "0-Day" test

"If the second square is larger than the first square or if [[A]] is less than 1, output {{ERROR}}."

Thank you Selenae ! 

I took note of what you said, does it make more sense now ?

If so and if you like the challenge, can you upvote / approve it , thank you :)

Thanks SubwayMan ! 

Umm on test case 7, I get the right output 4294967296, can you run this test again please ?

I'll fix the provided value according to the constraints of A

Umm as I said it to SubwayMan, the test works perfectly for me, I get the right output and CodinGame doesn't report any errors..

Can you tell me what value you have instead ?

I get 4294967293.
By the way, I will think that way is because your code makes 2147483647^2 become 4611686014132420600, and that's not correct for sure.
Or maybe I misunderstood the problem statement?
Btw, I use C++ and python, if you want to know

Thanks Jack,
I'll fix constraints and tests, tell me if it works well for you now :)

I'm absolutely certain that 4294967296 is incorrect, I have tested it with both code and basic pen-and-paper math.
Try the formula 2*A*(A mod B ) - (A mod B)^2. This formula should be fairly resistant to integer overflow.
